Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Feleucin-BO1 (Leu-rich; XXA; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; toad, amphibians, animals;  Derivatives: Feleucin-K3)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretion, Oriental fire-bellied toad,Bombina orientalis, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification: C-terminal amidation.Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 34 uM), but not Gram-negative bacteria or yeast.SAR: Changes of residues G3, G6, and S7 to K increased peptide activity as well as activity spectrum. By changing G3, G6, and S7 to lysines (i.e. feleucin-K3), the antibacterial activity of the peptide was enhanced (MIC 7-14 uM). Reg. 8/6/2014; 5/2020 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Hou X, Du Q, Li R, Zhou M, Wang H, Wang L, Guo C, Chen T, Shaw C.2014
Literature Information.Reference: Chem Biol Drug Des. 2014 Jul 23. doi: 10.1111/cbdd.12396.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Feleucin-BO1: a novel antimicrobial nonapeptide amide from the skin secretion of the toad, Bombina orientalis, and design of a potent broad-spectrum synthetic analogue, feleucin-K3.
